intro: Sisyrinchium arrayanicum, commonly known as the Mexican blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Sisyrinchium arrayanicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
